com.absio.crypto.mac

Class MacHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.crypto.mac.MacHelper

  • public class MacHelper
extends Object
    This is a helper class for dealing with Keyed-Hash Message Authentication Codes (HMAC) operations. This helper will operate using a single algorithm that is passed in the constructor. By default it will use MacAlgorithm.DEFAULT (HMACSHA384). Under the hood the Mac class is used.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MacHelper()
      Default constructor that creates a helper that uses MacAlgorithm.DEFAULT (HMACSHA384).
      MacHelper(MacAlgorithm algorithm)
      Constructor that creates a helper that uses the provided algorithm.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] digest(SecretKey key, byte[] data)
      Creates the message digest using the helpers algorithm for the given data using the given key.
      SecretKey generateKey()
      This generates a new SecretKey using the helpers MacAlgorithm.
      SecretKey generateKey(byte[] encodedKey)
      This generates a SecretKey from the given key bytes using the helpers MacAlgorithm.
      boolean verify(SecretKey key, byte[] data, byte[] digest)
      This will check to see if the passed in digest matches the digest created from the passed in key and data.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MacHelper

        public MacHelper()
          throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Default constructor that creates a helper that uses MacAlgorithm.DEFAULT (HMACSHA384).
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the HMACSHA384 algorithm is not supported

      • MacHelper

        public MacHelper(MacAlgorithm algorithm)
          throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Constructor that creates a helper that uses the provided algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithm this helper will use
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the algorithm is not supported

    • Method Detail

      • digest

        public byte[] digest(SecretKey key,
                     byte[] data)
              throws InvalidKeyException
        Creates the message digest using the helpers algorithm for the given data using the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to generate the digest with
        data - the data to generate the digest with
        Returns:
        the message digest using the helpers algorithm for the given data using the given key
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - thrown is the key is not the correct format

      • generateKey

        public SecretKey generateKey(byte[] encodedKey)
        This generates a SecretKey from the given key bytes using the helpers MacAlgorithm.
        Parameters:
        encodedKey - the HMAC key encoded bytes
        Returns:
        the SecretKey with the encoded bytes and algorithm

      • generateKey

        public SecretKey generateKey()
                      throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This generates a new SecretKey using the helpers MacAlgorithm.
        Returns:
        a new SecretKey with the helpers algorithm
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the helpers algorithm is not supported

      • verify

        public boolean verify(SecretKey key,
                      byte[] data,
                      byte[] digest)
               throws InvalidKeyException
        This will check to see if the passed in digest matches the digest created from the passed in key and data. NOTE: this will create the digest using the digest(SecretKey, byte[]) method. That method will use the MacAlgorithm defined for this helper.
        Parameters:
        key - the key used to create the digest
        data - the data use to create teh digest
        digest - the digest to verify
        Returns:
        true if the digest created from the key and data match the passed in digest value
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - thrown is the key is not the correct format
